name: side
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flat outer surface of an object, especially one that is not the top, the bottom, the front, or the back

example.eg: The names of ships are usually painted on their sides.
example.egtrans: 船的名字通常漆在船的侧面。

example.eg: The window on the right side of the house was open.
example.egtrans: 房子右侧的窗户开着。

example.eg: Please write on one side of the paper only.
example.egtrans: 请只在纸的一面书写。

example.eg: I've already written four sides (= pages of writing) for my essay.
example.egtrans: 我的论文已经写了4页纸了。

example.eg: Canadian coins have a picture of the British Queen's head on one side.
example.egtrans: 加拿大硬币的一面有女王的头像。

example.eg: Please use the side entrance.
example.egtrans: 请走侧门。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an edge or border of something

example.eg: A square has four sides.
example.egtrans: 正方形有4条边。

example.eg: There are trees on both sides of the road.
example.egtrans: 公路两旁都有树。

example.eg: They were surrounded on all sides/on every side by curious children.
example.egtrans: 他们被好奇的孩子们团团围住。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: I have a small table at/by the side of (= next to) my bed.
example.egtrans: 我的床边有一张小桌子。

example.eg: He stayed at/by her side (= with her) throughout her long illness.
example.egtrans: 在她久病期间，他一直陪伴着她。

trans_examp.trans_en: in a restaurant, an extra dish of food, for example vegetables or salad, that is served with the main dish, sometimes on a separate plate

example.eg: I’ll have a side of onion rings.
example.egtrans: 我要一个洋葱圈当配菜。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: 肩并肩地；一个挨一个地

example.eg: The children sat side by side on the sofa watching television.
example.egtrans: 孩子们肩并肩地坐在沙发上看电视。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of something, especially in relation to a real or imagined central line

example.eg: He likes to sleep on the right side of the bed.
example.egtrans: 他喜欢睡在床的右边。

example.eg: In Britain, cars drive on the left side of the road.
example.egtrans: 在英国，汽车靠左侧行驶。

example.eg: There is no money on my mother's side (of the family).
example.egtrans: 我娘家那边没有钱。

example.eg: I could just see Joan on the far/other side of the room.
example.egtrans: 我能看见琼在房间的另一边。

example.eg: Children came running from all sides (= from all directions).
example.egtrans: 孩子们从四面八方跑来。

trans_examp.trans_en: the part of the body from under the arm to the top of the leg

example.eg: I have a pain in my side.
example.egtrans: 我的肋部疼痛。

example.eg: What side is "Coronation Street" on?
example.egtrans: 哪家电视台在播出《加冕街》？

trans_examp.trans_en: half of an animal's body, considered as meat

example.eg: She bought a side of lamb from the butcher.
example.egtrans: 她从肉店里买了半扇羔羊肉。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: from left to right and from right to left

example.eg: The curtains were swinging from side to side in the breeze.
example.egtrans: 窗帘在微风中来回摆动。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: one of two or more opposing teams or groups
trans_examp.trans_cn: （多个相互对立的团队中的）一方

example.eg: This is a war which neither side can win.
example.egtrans: 这是一场双方都无法打赢的战争。

example.eg: Our side (= team) lost again on Saturday.
example.egtrans: 我们队星期六又输了。

example.eg: Which/Whose side are you on (= which team are you playing for/supporting)?
example.egtrans: 你是哪个队的？

example.eg: Don't be angry with me - I'm on your side (= I want to help you).
example.egtrans: 不要生我的气——我是站在你这边的。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to support one person or group rather than another, in an argument or war
dsense_body_def_block_kk.ddef_b_trans: （在争论或战争中）表明立场，支持一方

example.eg: My mother never takes sides when my brother and I argue.
example.egtrans: 我和弟弟吵架时，我母亲从不偏袒任何一方。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to support someone in an argument

example.eg: My mother always takes my father's side when I argue with him.
example.egtrans: 我和父亲争论时，母亲总是站在他一边。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: an opinion held in an argument, or a way of considering something

example.eg: There are at least two sides to every question.
example.egtrans: 每个问题至少有两个方面。

example.eg: I've listened to your side of the story, but I still think you were wrong to do what you did.
example.egtrans: 我已经听过你对此事的说法，但我仍然认为你的所作所为是错误的。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a part of a situation, system, etc. that can be considered or dealt with separately
trans_examp.trans_cn: （某一情形或系统中可单独处理的）一部分

example.eg: She takes care of the financial side of things.
example.egtrans: 她负责财务方面的事务。

example.eg: Fortunately my boss did see the funny side of the situation.
example.egtrans: 还好，我的上司也看到了其中好笑的一面。

dsense.name: side
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: She seems quite fierce, but actually she has a gentle side.
example.egtrans: 她看起来很凶，但实际上她也有温柔的一面。

name: side
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: not in or at the centre or main part of something

example.eg: We parked the car on a side street/road (= a small road, especially one that joins on to a main road).
example.egtrans: 我把汽车停在小道上。

example.eg: I think that's a side issue (= a subject which is separate from the main one) which we should talk about later.
example.egtrans: 我认为这是个次要问题，我们应该以后再讨论。

example.eg: I'd like a side dish of potatoes (= some potatoes on a separate plate).
example.egtrans: 我想要盘土豆作为配菜。
